page.title: 14Local Superstition
page.content: True Portlanders are very superstitious about saying "rabbits". Never will a Portlander say this, they call them bunnies, long ears, bobtails, furry things, wuffers, underground mutton or wilfreds. The superstition about rabbits is that a long time ago the rabbits were so numerous that their burrowing in the quarries used to cause landslides which lead to men being injured or killed. The superstition is so strong that some people would turn around and go home again if they saw a bunny when on their way to work. Other Portlanders have been known to take to their beds because the word "rabbit" was said in their house. Some fishermen will not go to sea for the same reason. Helen Reeve, Jackie Stamp and Helen Millard, all aged 14.
